evidence.text:
GARY: Listen, there's nothing in this for me - technically, I'm un-employing myself here, but do your future self, the one that deserves a happy, fulfilling life, that can still have that, a big favor. Take what's in there and get a new life. Right now. Don't go home.
GARY: And, if you need anything or if you change your mind... you have my number.

MADISON: You're not a hitman. You can't be. You cuddled puppies, you played with kids, you've opened every door for me tonight. And yet...you kill people for money?
MADISON: Right. So what's the difference between the real you and...your occupation.
MADISON: Tell me a little more about the unprofessional side.
MADISON: Good. I don't want you too professional.

MADISON: Why don't you show me, hot shot.
MADISON: Let's go dance, white boy.

GARY: We don't have a choice. Look, I know you're taking a big leap with me and there are some factual loose threads we'll be dealing with. But I think I'm in love with you.
MADISON: It's always a leap... And for the record, I think I'm in love with you, too. For better or worse?
GARY: So, we're in this till the end? Till death us do part?
